title: How many different combinations are there for answers to a 5-question true-false quiz? - Quora

response.answer_text: TTTTT, TTTTF, TTTFT, TTTFF, TTFTT, TTFTF, TTFFT, TTFFF, TFTTT, TFTTF, TFTFT, TFTFF, TFFTT, TFFTF, TFFFT, TFFFF, FTTTT, FTTTF, FTTFT, FTTFF, FTFTT, FTFTF, FTFFT, FTFFF, FFTTT, FFTTF, FFTFT, FFTFF, FFFTT, FFFTF, FFFFT, FFFFF Ok, now if you replace every T with 0 and every F with 1, you’ll realize I just counted from 0 to 31 in binary. Of course, the easy answer would be just to say there are 2⁵ or 32 different ways to answer a 5 question true or false test. Edit: You asked about combinations. In discrete mathematics, there are combinations and permutations. With combinations, the order doesn’t matter. With permutations the order does matter. In my answer above, the order does matter, so it’s a permutation. For combinations the answer is simpler: 5 true, 0 false; 4 true, 1 false; 3 true, 2 false; 2 true, 3 false; 1 true, 4 false; 0 true, 5 false. So there are 6 combinations.
